title: Termux slows down in "doze mode" (battery optimization) even with the wake lock
body:
This is not really a bug, but rather an "improvement request".

When Termux runs using the Wake Lock, the performance greatly slows down because of "Doze" (explained in details here: https://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/doze-standby.html)

> If a user leaves a device unplugged and stationary for a period of time, with the screen off, the device enters Doze mode. In Doze mode, the system attempts to conserve battery by restricting apps' access to network and CPU-intensive services. It also prevents apps from accessing the network and defers their jobs, syncs, and standard alarms.
> Periodically, the system exits Doze for a brief time to let apps complete their deferred activities. During this maintenance window, the system runs all pending syncs, jobs, and alarms, and lets apps access the network.
> As soon as the user wakes the device by moving it, turning on the screen, or connecting a charger, the system exits Doze and all apps return to normal activity

This means if you're connected with SSH on Termux, it will suddenly get really laggy (until you wake it up again), even worse if you use Termux as a web server.

See the conversation here: https://gitter.im/termux/termux?at=57a2253c836d2d0211610052

@fornwall said: "I'm just trying if disabling battery optimizaton for termux helps the wake-lock not working problem" and "I have disabled battery optimization earlier today and have not noticed any slowdowns yet. I will continue to test this."

The whitelist described here might be a solution: https://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/doze-standby.html#whitelisting-cases

Since I'm looking forward to this, here's an issue to know if it eventually does work :)

title: Feature Request: `mount loopback device`
body:
Feature Request: `mount loopback device`

This issue is fairly simple in Linux: **create file of a specific GB size > format filesystem in file > mount filesystem in file via loop device nonroot.** This sequence is impossible today on external micro SD storage in Termux on Android. You might even be mounting a filesystem from a file via loop device nonroot on a notebook or desktop without knowing it when you mount a USB stick, CD, DVD or similar. 

![screenshot_20170804-125035](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27742457/28978377-c7cc71a2-7913-11e7-97ba-e6517e95b0e9.png)

Referenced issues:

Feature Request: `mount loopback device`
https://plus.google.com/109614420080028230010/posts/4JcKJuy4ATa

Is it possible to grant permission for Termux to use loop devices?
https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues/375

Does Anyone Want to Have More Native Space on Device?
https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/issues/1176

https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues?utf8=✓&q=OTG

https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/issues?utf8=✓&q=OTG

**Reedited 20170804 UTC.** Previous version @ https://sdrausty.github.io/pages/376tapp

Debian Noroot might have the source code to close this issue. It appears to mount an image from a file using https://github.com/pelya/fakechroot "The scripts for creating Debian images are located in directory "img". https://github.com/pelya/debian-noroot/tree/master/img To prepare image, run these scripts:" from https://github.com/pelya/debian-noroot/blob/master/README.md

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.cuntubuntu Please check Debian Noroot out if you can. It uses 900MB at start. It has gimp https://www.gimp.org It has lots of goodies; But please remember, you will want a keyboard and mouse.

![screenshot_20170803-132456](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27742457/28934792-39d24264-7850-11e7-8ca3-dbb7bd1288e6.png)
Screenshot of Debian Noroot running on an Android smartphone. 

https://github.com/pelya/debian-noroot 

"Run Debian on top of Android with a single click. No root required! Should work on any high-end device! Unleash full unrestricted desktop environment onto your mobile device! Instant frustration guaranteed! (unless you're using mouse or stylus) [and keyboard]."

```
git clone https://github.com/pelya/debian-noroot
cd debian-noroot
git submodule init
git submodule update //doesn't work, requires passphrase!?
ack loop
ack mount 
ack device
ack img
```

title: Laggy backwards-scrolling in multiple applications
body:
I'm noticing that termux is very laggy when scrolling _backwards_ through applications.  This occurs both on local and remote (ssh'd _oot_ to other hosts) instances, which makes me suspect the issue is basic terminal functionality.

Example:

* Open Termux
* Open a large manpage using less as the pager.  The `bash` manpage is a good example.
* Skip to the end of the page (`G`).  From here:
* Single-line scrollback is relatively quick:  `k`
* Multi-line scrollback starts lagging:  `10k`
* A larger scrollback of 100 lines takes ~25 seconds:  `100k`
* Skipping to the top of the file sees a few seconds of lag, but not as much as the large scrollback:  `1G`

Vim noticeably _doesn't_ suffer from this (thankfully).  Pagers though do.

I'm looking to see if there's a way to access the Termux environment from another terminal to confirm my hunch.  The stock Android terminal environment cannot access the Termux files :(

**Termux Info**
```

Termux version:
<=0.48
Installed Termux apps:
package:com.termux.api  installer=com.android.vending
package:com.termux  installer=com.android.vending

All packages up to date

arm
```

title: Native Video Feature Request
body: How feasible would it be to add native video support for Termux? I am asking this in the context of this response: https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/issues/878#issuecomment-289184040

title: Not clickable "pkg install"
body:
Guys, it possible to let pass such obvious inconvenience on desktop terminals, where it's not so huge deal to copy-paste text (or even type for geeks):

But on mobile device surely `pkg install mosh` must be clickable link.

I know, that people usually very hard percieve direct criticism, but this situation is so obviously absurd, that I will risk to write naked truth without excuses.

title: possible to activate wake-lock from within termux
body: Is it possible to activate wake-lock from within termux terminal?

title: Basic accessibility support for the terminal view
body:
Terminal view as implemented in the termux app is a view resembling terminal windows known from computers. It's designed to be efficient however for me and other people who are using accessibility services such as Google Talkback to access their android devices it's not very usable. By adding contentDescription property to the view dynamically as it repaints, we can get at least very basic accessibility support.
When using termux on Android with Talkback running it is possible to review currently visible text on the screen by characters, by words and by lines.
It is possible to use two finger scrolling (android built-in feature) to scroll the view and access other parts of the text.
I'm using this for a few months already and I have got some friends interested in this functionality so I'm submitting this as a pull request.
I know it's very minimalistic, but even in its current limited form it's a life changing feature for tech savvy blind people so hopefully you can accept it and / or point out how I might be able to enhance it so everyone can benefit.

title: Remote ssh prompt keeps showing on termux tooltip after exiting a ssh session
body:
After exiting from an ssh session the termux tooltip shows the remote ssh session prompt `[1]username@hostname:~` instead of showing `[1]`.

The ssh server that I'm connecting to is currently OpenSSH_7.5p1 running on Arch Linux x86_64.

title: Permission denied in subdirectory of home folder
body: I am having an issue trying to get TaskWarrior to work on a new phone whereby no matter what I do any files in the /data/data/com.termux/files/home/.task can't be opened. The certificate and key files that TaskWarrior needs to sync were copied from the phone's Download folder to the .task directory. They copy fine using root browser, the user in Termux, and with su in Termux - however, once moved the copied files can't be opened. I have successfully setup TaskWarrior within Termux on my last phone and a tablet - and followed same steps with new phone so utterly baffled as to what the issue could be. Any help would be much appreciated.

termux-location take a wile but I doesn't get a result or error...

title: Add Multi Window support for Samsung devices
body:
A single meta-data entry is enough to make Termux "Multi Window" aware on supported Samsung devices.
Tested and confirmed working on Samsung Note Pro 12.2 running Android 5.1.1.
![screenshot_2017-06-12-01-22-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43441/27023950-03b6a4e8-4f12-11e7-975a-a09053c5326a.png)

This addition should not interfere with Android 6+'s split screen feature.
Tested and confirmed split screen functions as normal on a Nexus 6 running Android 7.0.

This addition should go unnoticed on non-Smasung Android 5 devices.
Tested and confirmed no functionality visible on Nexus 5 running Android 5.1.

bash-4.4#

title: "Permission denied" as non-root user after creating/editing files as root
body:
**Steps to reproduce**
1. Start up Termux and ensure you are in /data/data/com.termux/files/home/
2. Run `su`
3. Create a file with `touch test` or edit and save a file using vim
4. `exit` out of su
5. Run `rm test` or try to read file with vim
6. Change file permissions and ownership as root and try step 5 again

**Expected behaviour**
File can be deleted/read/edited as non-root user.

**Observed**
"Permission denied" occurs on any attempt to manipulate the file, including copying.

**Comments**
I tried `chmod 777` on first the file, and then on home/, and then tried `chown <user>` with no success. This bug doesn't happen in ~/storage/downloads.

I observed this error after editing my .bashrc in vim as a root user. After this, my non-root user does not even load up .bashrc when logging into bash.

title: Selection aid?
body:
Working with a terminal often involves selecting some text, and it is not really comfortable when the terminal is fullscreen and the text touches the screen edges. Including the edge characters into the selection becomes a rather non-trivial task... Can't help, but the selection aid from JuiceSSH springs into mind by itself... could we have something like that in Termux?

I'd even pay for an addon to do that.. or even an addon that does some additional higher-level text and/or input history manipilation. Like, automatically extracting paths and numbers from the available text body would be super-useful on a touch-driven device...

title: Choose architecture
body: I have things I want to do in termux that need 32 bit libraries (that don't appear to support multilib), but I have an aarch64 device. I see there's an autodetect function to decide which architecture to install, it would be great to be able to let the user decide.

title: MessagEase combining chars
body:
In [MessagEase](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MessagEase) combining chars can be entered by typing `e` `´` -> é, `o` `e` `[C]` -> œ, and so on. (`[C]` symbolic for north west drag on `a`.)

How is it possible to make this work in Termux?

title: Fix FC from too many control code parameters
body:
When the number of parameters in a CSI control code exceeds the size of
the mArgs array, the code may attempt to read past the end of the array,
resulting in a force close of the app.
    
Stop the index from moving past the last element of the mArgs array.

title: Make cursor save/restore affect color attributes
body:
SGR attributes are stored in three variables: mEffect, mForeColor, and
mBackColor.  Saving/restoring the cursor only preserves mEffect.

Change the cursor save/restore methods to additionally preserve
mForeColor and mBackColor.  This affects both 'explit' saving/restoring
the cursor and switching to/from the alternate screen buffer.

title: Change location of ~/bin/termux-url-opener
body: It's just a simple request. I'd like to change the location of `~/bin/termux-url-opener` script. And even maybe its name too.

title: Inconsistent touch response behavior within multiple pane screen session
body:
When running a newly created `screen` session with vertically and/or horizontally split panes, the touch screen can be used to select a pane within `screen`, but many touch screen interactions with command line programs (notably scrolling) do not function for programs such as `less` and `man` that are run inside of `screen` windows, even though such interactions work as expected when tested outside of `screen` (`emacs` is a notable exception; both cursor placement and scrolling function as expected for an `emacs` instance that's running inside of a `screen` window).

However, if a `screen` session is detached and then reattached, the touch screen interacts differently for both `screen` and the programs that are run inside of it. `screen` panes can no longer be selected with the touch screen (requiring the use of the C-a Tab key combo instead), but programs that are run within `screen` windows (`less`, `man`, etc.) appear to interact with the touch screen in the same way that they would if they were run outside of a `screen` session.  An exception to this generalization is the `bash` shell itself; while `bash` doesn't accept input from the touch screen when run outside of `screen`, a `bash` instance that is running inside of a reattached `screen` session seems to process movement across the touch screen as if presses of the arrow keys were being made.

I imagine that it might not be technically feasible to allow the touch screen's input to reliably affect both `screen` (through selecting window panes) and apps running inside of `screen` (through scrolling and other interactions) at the same time.  In any case, it may be desirable to adjust the behavior of `screen` in Termux such that the behavior of newly spawned `screen` sessions and newly attached `screen` sessions is the same in order to create a more consistent user experience.

In case it's of relevance, I quote my Termux environment's .inputrc below.  I have a few other environment files (including a .bashrc and .screenrc), but no others seem potentially related to this issue; let me know if you'd like to see any other files.

	$include /etc/inputrc

	"\e[A": history-search-backward
	"\e[B": history-search-forward
	"\e[C": forward-char
	"\e[D": backward-char
	"\eOC": forward-word
	"\eOD": backward-word
	"\C-H": kill-whole-line
	"\C-_": kill-whole-line

	C-p: history-search-backward
	C-n: history-search-forward
	#C-p: previous-history
	#C-n: next-history
	C-f: forward-word
	C-b: backward-word
	C-k: kill-line
	C-y: yank
	#C-_: undo // apparently, C-Backspace maps to this in mintty(?)

	$if Bash
		Space: magic-space
	$endif

	#set horizontal-scroll-mode on

On a final note, I greatly appreciate the implementation of `screen` in Termux; I had sorely missed the utility and familiarity of `screen` previous to that.

title: "touch: file.jpg: Operation not permitted" when trying to modify timestamp via touch
body:
I have a script which changes the timestamp of a file accoring to it's filename: (works fine on linux)

#!/bin/bash
for file in *.jpg
do
    test -f "$file" || continue
    # cut out the section with the timestamp (fixed width) and remove all _
    ts=$(echo ${file:4:15} | sed 's/_//g')
	# insert . before seconds to put it into the format requested by touch ([[CC]YY]MMDDhhmm[.ss])
	ts=${ts:0:12}.${ts:12:14}
    touch -t $ts $file
done  

I'd like to use this to fix all the timestamps in my DCIM/Camera folder, since they're fucked up after I manually copied them over from my old device.
I enabled storage access, the images have following permissions (output from ls -la):
-rw-rw---- 1 root everybod ....

My user is u0_a150, but it is not member of the group everbod :(

Using a Moto G5, Android 7.0

I guess I can't edit the files because my user not being a group member of everybod. Is it possible to fix this or is this just the pain in the ass of an unrooted Android?

body: Is it possible to enable/disable USB tethering from Termux or Termux-API?

title: Consider exporting TMPDIR by default
body:
Termux already exports `PREFIX`; could it export `TMPDIR` as well?

I'm looking at compiling a Go application that makes frequent use of `ioutil.TempFile`. I could patch all the usages, or I could patch the Go runtime itself, but as Go respects `TMPDIR`, defining it by default in Termux would be the easiest solution.

Note [TMPDIR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TMPDIR) is a Unix standard and many programs will respect it.

title: Write access to usb pen drive
body:
I have termux on my android tv box and I want to have write access to my plugged-in usb pen. I have tried running `termux-setup-storage` command and it created $HOME/storage but this directory doesn't have a path to my usb drive.  
My usb drive is on /storage/udisk0 and I don't have write access in this directory using Termux.
Not detecting /storage/udisk0/ is this a bug of `termux-setup-storage` or is there another way to have write access to /storage/udisk0/ ? 
Because on the termux help, regarding `termux-setup-storage`, it says that:

> The contents of the created $HOME/storage folder are symlinks to different storage folders:
(...)
~/storage/external
Symlink to a Termux-private folder on external storage (only if external storage is available).

but I have a usb plugged-in and when I run `termux-setup-storage` it doesn't create the ~/storage/external directory.
I would like to know how can I have write access to my USB pen as a normal user without being root.

title: Android O:  Permission denied on /proc entries for htop and top

I'm testing the Android O Dev Preview and I've found some up-coming issues with Termux to put on the radar for Android O compatibility. 

Utilities that read /proc (top, htop, etc.) are not working in Termux.

Examples:

htop: Cannot open /proc/stat: Permission denied
top: can't open 'stat': Permission denied

I'm guessing this is due to further locked down SELinux in Android O.

title: bidi behavior inconsistent; possibility to enable/disable bidi in termux settings?
label: [Label(name="bug report"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
In termux the bidi functionality seems to depend on which font is chosen from the termux style. for example when selecting gnu free font Hebrew is displayed right-to-left (although with bugs when typing or editing it), while when chosing default font or inconsolata font bidi is disabled and the text is displayed ltr. 

The bidi support in any terminal is not perfect and sometime it is desirable to simply disable it. some of the linux consoles like Konsol and gnome terminal allow the user to choose whether to enable or disable bidi support, is that possible to be done in termux as well? 

I think it would be useful to be able to completely disable bidi in termux because that thing never behaves in a predictable way and especially when editing and inserting text I find it easier to just work ltr.

label: [Label(name="bug report"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:

Debugger entered--Lisp error: (file-error "Creating directory" "No such file or directory" "/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tmp/babel-14591piN")
  make-directory-internal("/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tmp/babel-14591piN")
  make-directory("/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tmp/babel-14591piN")

Similar problem was fixed previously: http://endlessparentheses.com/running-emacs-on-android.html

I was able to solve this by using a wokraround based on the above, adding to the lisp file: (setq temporary-file-directory "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/).

title: Expose name and version as environment variables
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Many terminals (macOS Terminal, iTerm2, Hyper, …) exposes their name and version through the environment variables `TERM_PROGRAM` and `TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION`. It would be useful if Termux did the same.

Example:

```
~
❯ echo $TERM_PROGRAM        
Hyper

~
❯ echo $TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION
1.3.1
```

---

This would make the Termux detection in https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboardy/pull/10 nicer.

// @Rudloff

title: Cache downloaded deb files for sharing between devices.
label: [Label(name="information")]
body:
The current termux app doesnt cache the downloaded deb files.

Would be nice to cache downloaded deb files, as an advanced configurable option, not enabled by default.

title: feature request: mount remote fs using fuse
body:
hi,

it lookes like the kernel of my android phone dose support mounting things using user space code using fuse, one thing i miss about my android phone is the capability to mount remote filesystems from my nas/completer using sftp and smb.

```
$ su
root@jagnm:/ # cat /pr
proc/               property_contexts
root@jagnm:/ # cat /proc/filesystems
nodev   sysfs
nodev   rootfs
nodev   bdev
nodev   proc
nodev   cgroup
nodev   tmpfs
nodev   debugfs
nodev   sockfs
nodev   pipefs
nodev   anon_inodefs
nodev   devpts
        ext3
        ext2
        ext4
nodev   ramfs
        vfat
nodev   ecryptfs
        fuseblk
nodev   fuse
nodev   fusectl
        f2fs
nodev   selinuxfs
nodev   oprofilefs
root@jagnm:/ # ^D
$ ssh
ssh          ssh-agent    ssh-keygen   ssha
ssh-add      ssh-copy-id  ssh-keyscan  sshd
$ ssh
ssh          ssh-agent    ssh-keygen   ssha
ssh-add      ssh-copy-id  ssh-keyscan  sshd
$ apt-cache search fuse
libconfuse-dev - Development files for libconfuse
libconfuse - Small configuration file parser library for C
$ apt-cache search sshfs
$ apt-cache search smbfs
$
```

i would be every happy if you could port some of the software in debian to mount them using fuse.

thanks  lot in advance

title: I updated a package in termux and now it won't start...
body:
complaining about readline.so.6 being a missing dependency.

I tried updating the entire app from the Google Play store, but that didn't fix it.

I believe I'd installed a real shell a long time ago; I suspect this shell has the dependency, but there seems no way to get it to fall back to busybox.

Unfortunately, I have some files I need to get off and I believe totally uninstalling and reinstalling would lose them.

title: Allow adjusting line-height
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Some font like meslo has a very large line-height, while the others have a very small one (sometimes the character height almost exceeds the line-height).

It also makes airline or powerline in vim ugly since the arrows cannnot align.

Can you add an option for users to adjust line-height?

Thank you!

title: New Session in current dir
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I would like a feature to toggle Opening new Termux sessions in the current dir of an onscreen session.
Also, an intent to start a shell in specific dir from other apps would be awesome. For example, a share intent from a file manager to start a session in current dir.

title: Different fontsize in different session
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Is it possible to have different fontsizes in different sessions?

title: Home key doesn't work in Termux:Float but does in Termux (Hacker's Keyboard)
body:
I hope the title explained it enough...  
I am not using an external, nor physical, keyboard on this device, but I do have root and a few programs that have the potential to automate interaction (not used for those tasks yet, just a manually-made click-through overlay to show my battery status at each current time).

So far, that is the only key that I have tried and had any problems at all with.

The problem has caused some frustration on my end which is quite annoying:

* Going back to the start of a long line in the bash shell takes some time and I must start all over if I switch its command history with the nearby up or down keys.
* node interpreter (package nodejs) becomes a real annoyance because of the history does not save any changes like bash does... even temporairly. (I don't know if standard behavior.)

title: Text is cut from left side on Android TV
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
I installed the Termux app from the Google Play Store on the NVIDIA Shield Android TV running Android 7.0 at 4K 60Hz Resolution. But for some reason, the text on left side is cut a little bit. Though not much of a hindrance as Termux is still pretty usable. Sounds like a DPI problem. You can see the image below:

[https://ibb.co/kN13Jv](https://ibb.co/kN13Jv)

title: Dialogue in each session.
body: There is a dialogue displaying every time I create a new session. Is there anyway to disable that dialogue?

title: Never request permission
body:
I think you can call ensureStoragePermissionGranted() in main activity.onCreate()
sorry for my poor English,

title: Respect feedback behaviour on extra keys view
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="extra keys row")]
body: Extra keys view doesn't respect user defined feedback for keyboard, I mean, doesn't vibrate if is defined in preferences. I know there are many keyboards on the market but Android has a generic setting for this.

title: Bluetooth Connectivity
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Is it possible to connect to a bluetooth device currently connected to the Android device via Termux? Thanks.

title: Fails to start in Android 7.1.1
body:
On Android 7.1.1 (64-bit) I've encountered the following error after attempting to install Termux.
The storage permission has been granted to the app.
On Google I was unable to find any further information about it.

CANNOT LINK EXECUTABLE "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/bin/sh": cannot locate symbol "XzUnpacker_Construct" referenced by "/system/lib64/libunwind.so"...

[Process completed (signal 6) - press Enter]

title: CANNOT LINK EXECUTABLE: library "libldns.so.1" not found
body:
```
CANNOT LINK EXECUTABLE: library "libldns.so.1" not found
page record for 0xb6e8100c was not found (block_size=64)

[Process completed (code 1) - press Enter]
```

On CM13 (Android 6) on Galaxy S4.
Thus is shown when opening the app, so I cannot use it at all.

title: Option to restore sessions from widget
body:
Would it be possible, or maybe it already is, to restore opened sessions when tapping an entry on the widget, instead of launching a new one?

To be clear,
-make an ssh shortcut to a remote server
-start it
-do not close/disconnect from it
-start it again

You ends having 2 connections to the same server, i would like to have a way to choose the running one.

title: WebDAV client
body: cadaver, or davfs2

title: Termux cannot access sdcard
body:
Android 7.1 termux cannot access sdcard and may not have a storage device permission

安卓7.1termux不能访问sdcard，可能是没有储存设备权限

title: Extended keyboard: allow inline input (don't force newline)
body: Currently the extended keyboard is handy for entering natural language fragments for which suggestions are very helpful. But you're forced to do it line-oriented, why? There are many occasions when one just want to insert some text into an already written line.

title: Problem with Termux's terminal interface
body: I always get this problem with Termux when I type in long lines in the shell, especially if the device is in landscape mode. I will upload a screenshot

title: termux-storage-getfile returns immediately
body: `termux-storage-getfile` returns immediately.  This makes it hard to use in a script because the script continues before the user has selected a file from the dialog.  `termux-storage-getfile` should only return after the user has selected a file, and should have return value to indicate if user cancelled operation or not.

title: Preserve filename when using termux-storage-getfile
body:
The `termux-storage-getfile` mechanism gives no way to preserve the original filename.

Is it possible to implement something to preserve the filename?? 

For example, calling `termux-storage-getfile` without a destination filename, causes the script to create a file with the same name of the file that is selected in the popup and copies into it.

Even better if `termux-storage-getfile` is enhanced so it can select multiple files at once, instead of one at a time.

title: Termux notification persists after exit with wake-lock
body:
This can be reproduced by creating a session, pulling down the notification shade, enabling the wakelock, then killing all sessions with either `exit` or long-press then kill process, and pushing enter to exit.
The result is the notification displaying `0 sessions (wake lock held)`.

title: Cannot Upgrade command-not-found
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
It's my first time to use this so I did `apt update` then do `apt install` to each packages list. However, when it comes to command-not-found, an error occurred:

Err:1 http://termux.net stable/main i686 command-not-found i686 1.17
  404  Not Found [IP: 104.18.36.234 80]
E: Failed to fetch http://termux.net/dists/stable/main/binary-i686/command-not-found_1.17_i686.deb  404  Not Found [IP: 104.18.36.234 80]

E: Unable to fetch some archives, maybe run apt-get update or try with --fix-missing?

title: Make the ~/bin/termux-url-opener script run in background
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: It would be nice to have the ~/bin/termux-url-opener script (which executes when selected through the share menu of Android Apps) run in background without opening the termux terminal. Maybe this additional background functionality can be added with Termux:Widget addon in which background scripts are placed in ~/.shortcuts/tasks.

title: Extra key on overly
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="extra keys row")]
body: I'd be nice if you add shift key on overly along with cntrl and alt keys...

title: Use the external storage if avaliable
body: Termux currently uses its private data directory in /data/data to store all the store. But this becomes a little pain when the packages installed and the files in the Termux /home grows. Like for example I have Python, c-lang, ruby, rails and django installed and my termux data size has grown over 50MB. As the internal storage is also used by the OS to install apps and is the default storage for all apps, Termux becomes a problem. So why not use the devices' external storage for Termux files. Not will Termux get more space but will also keep the device's internal storage free.

title: Unable to use ctrl emulation if volume keys are used for navigation
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
CM 13 provides an option to use volume up/down keys as a left/right key emulation. It's a feature that makes the barely usable vkb a little more usable.

OTOH, Termux uses vol. down & up to emulate ctrl button and other, useful non alphanumerical characters.

Would it be possible to add an option to remap these? I would, for example, be really happy if Termux used the back button instead. Of course, not everyone, hence the word: option. This should be configurable, of course.

title: ChromeOS set to Dvorak, Termux uses Qwerty
label: [Label(name="bug report"), Label(name="chrome-os"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I've searched for separate keyboard settings for Android buried in the ChromeOS settings tree, but haven't been able to locate them.  Expected behavior is that when ChromeOS is set to use Dvorak, Termux would too.  Actual behavior is that Termux input is set to Qwerty, regardless of ChromeOS setting.

Chromebook Flip, not in dev mode. Termux installed via Play Store.

title: App icon looks ugly on MIUI
label: [Label(name="bug report")]

title: Use of usb serial port - e.g. Node.js/serialport/johnny five
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
tl;dr;
I have been attempting to use Node.js on termux to speak to a serial converter on a usb port (Tablet->OTG->USB->Arduino).  Have had a few issues with Node/Serial.  This is partly issue/potential planning for a pull (haven't done one before)

full version,
When trying to open the /dev/tty as per the node-serialport example

https://github.com/EmergingTechnologyAdvisors/node-serialport

var SerialPort = require('serialport');
var port = new SerialPort('/dev/tty-usbserial1', {
  baudRate: 57600
});

I tried ttySAC01 and a few others that were present in /dev but am getting 

Error: Error: Permission denied, cannot open /dev/ttySAC0
    at Error (native)

first line gives this
WARNING: linker: /data/data/com.termux/files/home/node-ardx/node_modules/serialport/build/Release/serialport.node has text relocations. This is wasting memory and prevents security hardening. Please fix.

I made a fork of termux-app and added this line to the AndroidManifest.xml

 <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.usb.host" />

but as yet haven't had luck.

I know it's possible on android (non-rooted) through java (See https://github.com/mik3y/usb-serial-for-android) and i found a C/JNI one too.  I looked at another option which creates a 'symlink' type tty device (pseudo tty) but this fails due to permissions also.  I've seen the minicom package - but not sure how it is used to connect to serial (i skimmed through the code but can't see where it hooks into serial)

Is this a matter of adding more permissions to termux? or would it involve more involve coding to make a pretend /dev device?  I figured it would be more usable to have it available through termux than building up a java app specifically for it.  Another use case is Node-RED.

(I have also been attempting to build an updated termux-package for node 7.xx but ran into trouble with V8 dependencies on mkpeephole...)

title: Super-quick hack for offline installation
body:
This is a quick change to the code so that the application does not require a network connection in order to be installed.

This implements a fix to issue #1 .

I needed to locally install this app offline, so implemented this, and am sharing my work for others.

This code could be generalized so as to provide one codebase that could be used for both offline and online installations, depending on whether the appropriate asset file is bundled.  This would be easy to do, but I have not done it yet.

title: Error installing python package 'cryptography'
body:
**Edit: similar to closed issue #203** 

I can't seem to get `$ pip install cryptography` to work in [termux](https://github.com/termux/termux-app). According to the [log.txt](https://github.com/termux/termux-app/files/702968/log.txt), there appears to be an issue related to `gcc` and/or `openssl`. Here's a snippet:

```
    generating cffi module 'build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/_openssl.c'
    building '_openssl' extension
    creating build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/build
    creating build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5
    gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -march=armv7-a -mfpu=neon -mfloat-abi=softfp -Os -fPIC -I/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/include/python3.5m -c build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/_openssl.c -o build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/_openssl.o
    build/temp.linux-armv7l-3.5/_openssl.c:434:10: fatal error: 'openssl/opensslv.h' file not found
    #include <openssl/opensslv.h>
             ^
    1 error generated.
    error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1

    ----------------------------------------
Command "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/bin/python -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/pip-build-udm32g1q/cryptography/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/pip-ax214z9a-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile" failed with error code 1 in /data/data/com.termux/files/usr/tmp/pip-build-udm32g1q/cryptography/
```

So far I've run the following commands:

```
$ apt update && apt upgrade
$ apt install python
$ apt install python-dev
$ apt install clang
$ apt install libffi-dev
$ apt install openssl-tool
```
And the relevant versions are:

```
Python version 3.5.2
pip version 9.0.1
clang version 3.9.1
OpenSSL version 1.0.2j
```

Any advice would be appreciated. Thanks :+1: 

P.S. By the way, I need the [cryptography](https://github.com/pyca/cryptography) package for [keyring](https://github.com/jaraco/keyring), which in turn is required, ultimately, for [urlwatch](https://github.com/thp/urlwatch).

P.P.S. [cryptography man page](https://cryptography.io/en/latest/installation/) for the  more technically inclined

title: coreutils: tail still not behaving properly with -c and no file argument

`echo -n 123456 | tail -c 3`
Now gives the following error
`tail: 'standard input': cannot seek to relative offset 0: Illegal seek`

`echo -n 123456 | tail -c 3 -`
`echo -n 123456 | tail --bytes 3`
Also give the same error

I tried the following with included busybox and get the appropriate output
`echo -n 123456 | busybox tail -c 3`
`echo -n 123456 | busybox tail -c 3 -`
`--bytes` option with busybox isn't available

title: [Feature Request] Option to change default home folder
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: To something like internal storage rather than somewhere in the system partition which typically has much less space available.

title: Feature Request: Recognize URL's to open in browser
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is a feature common in a number of modern terminal applications (some otherwise requiring the use of CTRL+LClick). In the case of [enlightement's terminology](https://www.enlightenment.org/about-terminology), URL's are recognized natively, for example. Given termux-open-url and touch integration on Android devices (including some ChromeOS devices with Android Runtime), I find in day-to-day use that this feature would be very handy.

Off-hand, the console parser would have to watch for anything that starts with http:// or https:// or www. and terminating extraction at the first \s character (and of course removing line-feed characters).

This only happened after the Termux update, as I haven't updated the Player itself since the jump to Android 7.1.1 back on December 5th, and this doesn't occur in other apps.  This is not an issue on my phone.

Again, I don't know whether this device is a priority, but I hope I can get Termux working on it again, as the SSH daemon is my main method of transferring files on and off this thing.

Thank you.

title: Cursor color defaults

As of now it defaults to hex color a9aaa9. (I believe it was introduced in commit 9fe0e494734cf30484c2af14df012c128515f030).

title: Scrolling upwards inside tools has problems
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Hello,

I would like to report an issue with scrolling inside Termux.

* Using a bt hw keyboard:
While scrolling up (both per page and per line) inside tools such as "man" pages or "less", the scrolling is pretty much delayed, slow and otherwise very jerky/laggy. Scrolling down works like a charm, as it should.

* Using the touchscreen (sliding it with fingers):
Same effect can be observed while using the touch screen to scroll up inside programs/tools. Scrolling up lags, scrolling down works perfectly. However, while remaining on the main shell window/screen (i.e. not using "man" or "less", etc.), both upwards and downwards scrolling works properly.

termux: v0.44
sw: android 6.0.1
hw: samsung galaxy tab s2 (w/ proper samsung bt hw keyboard)


Great work with Termux! I really like this app and appreciate the development.

title: Private Storage is only option to run Node.js
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I've tried to do some node.js development and attempted to use termux to run the commands. Everything works fine when using Termux's private storage, but when I copied over all of my files to the Shared Internal Storage, I ran into the error: "maximum call stack size exceeded", and it failed to compile. 

I followed this blogpost: https://medium.freecodecamp.com/building-a-node-js-application-on-android-part-1-termux-vim-and-node-js-dfa90c28958f#.7h71s73jd, which ran into the same issue. 

What are the differences in functionality b/w the Shared Internal Storage vs. the Private Storage? 

Getting this to work in shared storage would be valuable because then I could edit the files through another app, and run them through Termux. Would love to help out, just don't know where to start. Any pointers would be appreciated.

title: Keyboard backspace key sends DEL
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Using Google Keyboard on Android 6. The on-screen symbol is a funky pentagon with 'x', and might actually be an official symbol for 'DEL' in some contexts. Anyway, it is far more convenient for me if it sends ASCII BS 0x08 rather than DEL 0x7f.

This is of course a variable matter between different physical terminals and, these days, emulators. Many emulators have a config setting to choose between (a few will even let you send the Dec VT102 Advanced Mode or Function Mode or whatever it is, complicated ESC [ blahblah sequence, but I'll not ask for that... :)

Please add the setting for 'Backspace key send DEL | BS'. DEL would be the sensible default so as to not break existing users. OR, if the setting already exists, consider this a doc bugreport since I completely failed to find it...

title: ESC-c (reset) does not clear scrollback
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
ctlseqs.txt in xterm source says that ESC c is the keycode for a full reset. This is the same for many terminals.
excerpt from ctlseqs.txt
```
ESC c     Full Reset (RIS).
```

the "reset" binary (on my android phone, from toybox) writes the ESC-c sequence when run. output from strace.
```
write(1, "\33c", 2)                     = 2
```

while this works on desktop terminals (via adb shell), this doesn't work so well on termux or other android terminal emulators. is this intended behavior? will this be fixed?

title: launcher mode support?
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
is it _possible_ to have termux as a "launcher" screen?

this angle has been looked at by TUI-ConsoleLauncher ( https://github.com/Andre1299/TUI-ConsoleLauncher ), and I'd think that it would be nice to have an "optional" launcher mode.

a couple of user scripts using the Termux:API add-on and auto complete (volup + T) will make a _good_ launcher.

as for the "launching" apps part, can be either done as a addon extension to Termux:API or _*cough*_ su am start com.package/.Activity _*cough*_ some userscripts.

When I try

I get the following error:

SSH into the device manually works though.

It seems that rsync cannot find the working directory while connecting, while `pwd` works fine in an interactive terminal over SSH. Tried to expand my SSH config alias into a verbose rsync command, does the same: `rsync -rvz -e 'ssh -p 8022' --progress  u0_a122@192.168.44.1:/some-folder ~/some/local/folder/`  returns

I accidentally ran `apt update` as `root`, and now I can't run it as a regular user anymore. Even before, I noticed some odd file permission issues, and they seem to be related. I don't know how to recover.

After running `apt update` as root, several files were set to `root` as owner and group, e.g.

    $ ls -al ../usr/var/lib/apt/lists/termux.net_dists_stable_InRelease
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 1684 2016-11-21 05:10 ../usr/var/lib/apt/lists/termux.net_dists_stable_InRelease

Now the weird thing is, even after resetting the permissions back to the regular user, the file remains inaccessible:

What could be the reason?

title: Android N multi-window support
body:
This PR adds full multi-window support for Android 7.0+.

As soon as the framework enters multi-window mode a new button "New window" (keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Alt+W) becomes visible in the drawer menu. Clicking the button will create a new window. Terminal sessions are shared between windows, however, only one terminal window may attach to a specific session at a time. When creating a new window, the first unattached session will be attached to the new window. If no unattached sessions are available, a new session will be created.

Some screenshots of Termux running in multi-window mode on Android 7.1.1:
![screenshot_1478367704](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1225211/20032461/ab02a302-a38a-11e6-9e1c-db09b7a6f8cf.png)
(split-screen)

![screenshot_1478368051](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1225211/20032462/b1049f30-a38a-11e6-82d0-26728d18c52e.png)
(freeform mode)

In the second screenshot, for example, the left window may not be attached to sessions 2 and 3, since they are already attached to the other windows. Any window can switch to session 4.

title: Use HTTPS for apt-get
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be nice if you could preinstall `apt-get-transport-https` and use https://termux.net/ as the default source for apt-get.
Post-snowden we should know that metadata matters and the list of installed packages is a big source of metadata, which can easily be protected by using HTTPS.

Quite recently also Debian acknowledges that and [provides Onion services for apt-get now](https://guardianproject.info/2016/07/31/howto-get-all-your-debian-packages-via-tor-onion-services/). I think going so far for Termux would be too much (at least for a default config), but HTTPS should be the baseline nowadays.

However it has to be said that the way HTTPS is used at https://termux.net/ is not good right now as it uses Cloudflare. And as Cloudflare [is MITM](https://scotthelme.co.uk/cloudflares-great-new-features-and-why-i-wont-use-them/) [build-in](https://medium.com/@karthikb351/airtel-is-sniffing-and-censoring-cloudflares-traffic-in-india-and-they-don-t-even-know-it-90935f7f6d98#.s6tuvsrzy) in may not be the best choice. However it might be okay, if you at least use "Full SSL (Strict)" or "Keyless ssl" as these methods at least do at least properly encrypt the traffic between Cloudflare and your server.

title: Run Termux scripts from Android Debug Bridge [How to]
label: [Label(name="information")]
body:
**Run Termux scripts from Android Debug Bridge**

If you want to run a Termux script from adb use one of the following methods:

**Method 1:**  
This method will run the script regardless of whether a Termux shell is already running not.  
However you have to allow adb root access on your phone.

```
adb shell am startservice -n com.termux/com.termux.app.TermuxService -a com.termux.service_execute -d /data/data/com.termux/files/home/.shortcuts/script.sh
```

The -d option is the path/script-name that you want to run.  

If you don't want to allow adb root access you can use the following:

**Method 2:**

```
adb shell am start -n com.termux/com.termux.app.TermuxActivity
adb shell input text '/data/data/com.termux/files/home/.shortcuts/script.sh'
adb shell input keyevent 66
```

The 1st line opens a Termux shell  
The 2nd line types in the path/script-name  
The 3rd line presses the enter key  

**Warning:** This method will bring to the forefront a Termux shell if one is currently running and use it. If it is not sitting at a waiting bash prompt, the script will not run.

If you want to kill any running Termux shells to insure that the script runs use the following:

```
adb shell am force-stop com.termux
```

This will kill all running Termux shells and everything associated with it.

**Note:**  
The script doesnt have to be in the .shortcuts directory.  
Thats only a requirement of termux-widgets.

This is also at https://github.com/st42/termux-run_termux_scripts_from_adb.git

title: Terminal emulation: blinking cursor?
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I'm not sure it's a bug, because the last time I dug into the intricacies of Unix terminal definitions was really long ago, and I ran away screaming. But it kind of presents a practical problem:

The cursor does not natively blink, and Emacs can't _make_ it blink.

Also, the result of running `tput cnorm` and `tput cvvis` commands is identical, a rectangle cursor, when the first one is supposed to produce an underscore cursor, so something is very probably wrong.

This is kind of a problem in Emacs, because when background is used for highlighting _(i.e. on TODO items in org-mode)_ the block cursor can become completely invisible while over the highlighted text, and blinking cursor becomes a necessity.

title: Home key on a bluetooth keyboard does not work
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Thanks for making proper Linux on Android practical! Now it's just a matter of getting it all to work smoothly.

It took me a while to figure out why the escape key on my bluetooth keyboard isn't working, but once I found out that it's sending KeyCode 4, which is KEYCODE_BACK, I've been able to fix this through `termux.properties`.

But now I have another problem - the key for Home cursor move (Fn+Left) is not getting registered at all, (tested with `vtshowkeys`) even though it's sending keycode 122, which _should_ be MOVE_HOME. It is otherwise identical to the Left key _(same Meta State, same source, same keyboard type, the only thing different is the key code)_ so it should, in theory, work, but doesn't.

As a side note, External Keyboard Helper _(which I can't use to remap keys, since it completely borks Alt keys in Termux. I haven't been able to figure out why.)_ has one right idea: It is supposed to be capable of only reinterpreting keys if they come from an input device with an ID that is higher than a certain threshold. Hardware keys on the device itself typically come first, so you can have the back key on the device and the escape key on the keyboard at the same time. Could this possibly be implemented for the 'escape' setting in `termux.properties`?

title: Ctrl+Shift+(+/-) already mapped on ChromeOS
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Background: ChromeOS now allows the installation of Android Apps as a beta feature released to certain chromebooks. Cf. https://www.chromium.org/chromium-os/chrome-os-systems-supporting-android-apps

Ctrl+Shift+(+/-) is already mapped to resolution adjustment on ChromeOS. In order to allow text resizing in Termux, this modifier should be changed to something that will not be interpreted by the host. According to the keymap (brought up with Ctrl+Alt+/ on any chromebook), the best solution would be to use Ctrl+Alt instead.

title: Content changes in Termux storage aren't reflected in DocumentsProvider
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
TermuxDocumentProvider isn't notifying of content change.
Can do so using ContentProvider notification system. See docs starting at "To support change notifications..."

https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/DocumentsProvider.html#queryChildDocuments(java.lang.String, java.lang.String[], java.lang.String)

How to repro:

In Android Nougat DocumentsProviders are visible in Downloads sidebar.
Open Downloads.
Open Sidebar.
Select "Termux" entry in draw > see Termux content loaded in main window.

Switch to Termux app.
cd to same directory visible in Downloads app.
touch newfile

Switch to Downloads app.

Expected:
See "newfile" listed.

Actual: 
No "newfile" seen.

Note: Clicking away from directory and back shows "newfile".

 Cheers! Termux is really fun!

title: Feature Request: sixel graphics mode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sixel is a raster protocol format part of VT200 and VT300 serial terminals
it recently started gaining traction on command line tools to output images directly to the terminal because it works trought ssh, works reasonably well, etc 
for an implementation detail to copy the encoder/decoder, one can look at https://github.com/saitoha/libsixel , the url documents also a series of terminals and programs that support the standard
I realize it's a low priority feature, but it'd allow rather nice semi graphical workflow under termux's terminal, currently  it's already possible to view sixel graphics from launching a ssh daemon and connecting externally with a sixel capable terminal emulator

# Problem

When inputting Japanese characters (Kanji, Hiragana, Katakana), we usually toggle Japanese-input mode by halfwidth/fullwidth (半角/全角) key ([see wikipedia for details](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language_input_keys)).

Could you please fix it? :pray:

Model: Xperia Z4 Tablet (SGP712)
Attached keyboard: BKB50 (The official Z4 Tablet's Bluetooth keyboard)
Android version: 6.0.1
Software keyboard (enabled when inputting Japanese then suggests words): POBox Plus (The default software Japanese keyboard of SGP712. Version unknown)

title: Make ExtraKeysView work on Android 5
body:
On Android 5 ExtraKeysView shows empty (though can be swiped for TextView).

This is fixed by explicitly specifying alignment as GridLayout.FILL

I have figured out that this was fixed in Android 6 in commit
https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base/+/6dafd87fb4174447018b044bc67818d54fab57d8%5E%21/#F0
which set default alignment to FILL if weight is nonzero

title: Install packages to /system [feature request]
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This may be a simple question, but since the installer is within the app, I figured I should ask it here. Termux is a wonderful app, and I use it almost on a daily basis. However, so often times I prefer to use the packages it provide from adb to manage my phone, and debug my own scripts and apps. I also prefer to use some other Terminal Emulator apps with Termux packages, rather than its own emulator. This is due to many reasons, such as being used to them, having more ready plugins, supporting tabs and easy style configuring.

I always use the solution provided [here](https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues/77) to do so, however I think this process could be more easy, and robust if other people use Termux with their own Terminal emulators.

My purpose is that Termux Installer should provide a way to install its binaries to the /system/bin or /system/xbin, if the device is rooted. Also, it needs to either install the libraries in the proper /system directory, and/or add the binary and library directories to the PATH so that using termux outside its emulator could be as easy typing `tmux` in the console.

Of course, installing to the /system should _not_ be enabled by default, and it should be done so only if the device has root access, and the user chooses to do so.

Please consider adding this, I think install the bin files to the /system/bin directory will be both useful, and make more sense to Linux devs. :)

title: Termux is randomly closing / loosing sessions
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Hi, this has been talked about on #termux quite a bit, a while ago. But I'm opening an issue here, because it still affects me (on 3 different phones) and so it doesn't get forgotten and because it is quite severe. 

On my phones, Termux would randomly close. This happens mostly in the middle of the night (on 2 out of 3 nights), but it has also happened multiple times while I was working with it over SSH. 
## Possible causes
### FolderSync

At night my phone is running a few [FolderSync](http://www.tacit.dk/foldersync) tasks. There aren't a lot of files to be synced, but it does check a lot of files. I've checked and FolderSync isn't using up Memory or CPU. 
### Jekyll

In the cases of it closing while I'm working with it, it has happened noticably more frequent when working with Jekyll, while Jekyll is generating the website.  
## Speculation

It seems to happen during times of high filesystem activity. Is it maybe related to a filesystem interrupt? Like a file that needs to be read by the app which it can't do because the filesystem is overloaded?

All this happens with or without Wakelock held. Termux isn't entirely closing, it just seems to loose the session. The following screenshot shows "0 terminal sessions" and the Wakelock isn't held. As far as I know, Termux should only show 0 Sessions when a Wakelock is held. 
![screenshot_20160731-090626](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7983745/17275383/f69ed992-5705-11e6-87bf-f49f2569981f.png)

I also once made termux do a continous logcat until it closed. https://gist.github.com/Neo-Oli/faa32ecb939c1f88cbcd7748a8377600

So far, this has only happened on marhmallow phones. It first appeared the day after I upgraded from KitKat.

Sadly, I can't produce a reproducible test case that doesn't involve waiting for 12 hours. I'm hoping someone else has the same issue as me. I'd be willing to run any test builds or do any debugging I can.

title: Apt update doesn't resolve properly when using Orbot's transproxy
label: [Label(name="bug report")]
body:
Apt update doesn't work when you proxy it through tor (using orbot's transparent proxy). This is the error message you get:
apt update
Ign:1 http://termux.net stable InRelease
Err:2 http://termux.net stable Release
  403  Forbidden
Reading package lists... Done
E: The repository 'http://termux.net stable Release' does not have a Release file.
N: Updating from such a repository can't be done securely, and is therefore disabled by default.
N: See apt-secure(8) manpage for repository creation and user configuration details.
After disabling tor, everything works perfectly.

title: Zooming with Keyboard + Mouse
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="question")]
body: I have an ODROID XU 4, which has no touchscreen but is controlled via KBM. Is there any way to change the font size with this since AFAIK there is no way to replicate a pinch zoom with KBM?

title: pageUp/Down gesture supported as pageUp/Down keys (or mouse wheel)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Since console apps has no knowledge of gestures, if we can convert pageUp/Down gestures to keys or mouse wheel events, it will enable more creative usages in termux.

For example, current gesture support is non-functional when using less in neovim terminal mode.

to reproduce the bug, enter neovim terminal mode with:
$ nvim -c term
Inside the neovim terminal mode, run 
$ less txtfile
Then pageUp/Down gestures trigger neovim quit terminal insert mode and thus make it nonfunctional.

Running less in neovim terminal mode in linux, pressing pageUp/Down keys or mouse wheel works perfectly.

title: Change double-tap and drag behavior from quick scale to mouse drag event
body:
I've partly implemented the feature requested at [this issue](https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues/35).

I think zoom with two finger pinching is already enough, so I change the reaction of double tap and drag from quick zoom to mouse left button drag event sending to emulator. It can help a lot e.g. under emacs, vim and tmux when you want to resize window or select text.

title: keep getting ”integer overflow” with many termux apps
body:
cannot figure out what is generating this error, is it specific to termux, is a warning or error.  however execution appears to halt:

```
$ mosh myserver
internal error: integer overflow 2147483647 * 4 prevented
mosh: Can't count colors: 22

$ su -l; id -un
internal error: integer overflow 2147483647 * 4 prevented
u0_a39

$ uname -a
Linux localhost 3.4.42-g7f4d949-00002-gb042f2b #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue Jan 6 10:06:17 CST 2015 armv7l Android
```

same issue appears to prevent `pip install pycrypto` from successfully running `configure`:

```
[...snip]
creating build/lib.linux-armv7l-3.5/Crypto/Signature
    copying lib/Crypto/Signature/__init__.py -> build/lib.linux-armv7l-3.5/Crypto/Signature
    copying lib/Crypto/Signature/PKCS1_v1_5.py -> build/lib.linux-armv7l-3.5/Crypto/Signature
    copying lib/Crypto/Signature/PKCS1_PSS.py -> build/lib.linux-armv7l-3.5/Crypto/Signature
    Skipping optional fixer: buffer
    Skipping optional fixer: idioms
    Skipping optional fixer: set_literal
    Skipping optional fixer: ws_comma
    running build_ext
    running build_configure
    internal error: integer overflow 2147483647 * 4 prevented
    internal error: integer overflow 2147483647 * 4 prevented
    error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'src/config.h'
```

I have a Moto G 2014 (”titan” board model) with a stock ROM.  I traced the processes doing the write(2) of the integer overflow error and it's indeed the actual processes themselves (such as `mosh` above after the shell script wrapper has `execve()`'d `mosh` itself), so it's almost like it's coming from libc or something.  I cannot find these error substrings anywhere in Google searches so I am very puzzled where this is coming from, but unfortunately it makes termux rather unusable.

title: Close session without waiting for <Enter> if process terminates with SIGHUP or exit status 129
body:
See https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues/56#issuecomment-218978463

I added the exit status 129 check because Marshmallow /system/bin/sh seems to violate  http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/sh.html#tag_20_117_09 (by catching the signal and acting as if the last child process had received it).

Fixes #56

title: termux cannot take the underlined candidates with soft keyboards
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
In android soft keyboards, sometimes there will be some predicted inputs (usually underlined) in the text area waiting for confirmation. Termux can not take these inputs even after confirmation.

To reproduce, use a soft keyboard for input in search bar, find an input mode (usually handwriting mode will do), where some underlined predicted text will be firstly shown in search bar before confirmation. After further inputs, these underlined text will become solid (not underlined again). Termux has issues to take these underlined inputs.

One specific example is Shouxin input method for CJK in handwriting mode. Termux simply does not take any underlined candidates.

title: To build a terminal apk just contains an executable file
body:
Hello! I'm a student and I'm very interested in programming but not allowed to use computer.  :(
One day I found an app [c4droid](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.n0n3m4.droidc) and I used it to do my programmings.  :) It has a nice option called export, which you can put your executable file into an apk and share it with your friends. I ever made a term-2048 game using ncurses. But the terminal doesn't support 256-color.  It doesn't support init_color(). That's to say, I can just use about eight standard colors. Later, I found [termux](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.termux). Yes, it supports. But how could I export an apk just like [c4droid](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.n0n3m4.droidc). Could you add this fantastic feature or is there any other solution? Thank you.

title: Hacker's Keyboard overlaps terminal in 5-row mode
body:
If you use Termux together with [Hacker's Keyboard](https://github.com/klausw/hackerskeyboard) in landscape mode, or more generally in 5-row mode (which is the default for landscape), the keyboard will hide the last couple of lines at the bottom and you basically won't see what you're typing.

As a workaround, you can set the height of the keyboard in Hacker's Keyboard options to < 40% height of the screen but this obviously makes it harder to type in 5-row mode.

Android version: 6.0.1 (CyanogenMod 13.0)
Termux: 0.34
Hacker's Keyboard: 1.38.2

I think this might be the same problem as in #87 but I wasn't entirely sure hence a new issue. Feel free to close if it's a duplicate.

title: Google Keyboard 5 layout issue
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
I tested the new [Google Keyboard 5](http://www.xda-developers.com/google-keyboard-5-0-update-brings-one-handed-mode-adjustable-height-key-borders-and-more/) and something is not right.

While Firefox shows the layout as I want (no numbers row; secondary chars on long press), Termux does not

Pic ([KISS has the same issue](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/issues/454)): https://i.imgur.com/UFLNXFR.jpg

Now, looking at them side by side I see one more difference: the Enter/Search key.
So, it might be a different activity/intent, that is called in Termux, that changed since Google Keyboard version 4?

Thanks.

title: Expose files to external editors using Storage Access Framework
body:
I'd like to use Termux for git/compiling/executing, but prefer external Android editors for editing source code.

The obvious approach, of doing `git init` or `git clone` in `/sdcard` fails with:
`error: chmod on /storage/emulated/0/reponame/.git/config.lock failed: Operation not permitted`
(see https://plus.google.com/+LarsStokholm/posts/eZqMLNmKX1n and similar issue https://github.com/corbinlc/gnuroot/issues/55). It would be great to find a workaround for that, but it seems tricky.

So instead, how about making Termux's app-private storage available to other apps via a Storage Access Framework DocumentsProvider? For example with [Turbo Editor](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.maskyn.fileeditor) you can enable "Use the Storage Access Framework" from the right hand drawer, and then it uses the SAF to open files, and can subsequently save them to the same location. Not quite as flexible as making files available via the sdcard, but perhaps better than nothing?

title: suggestion: coreutils by default
body:
I suggest that this app installs coreutils by default, and sets path correctly so they are used by default, by default.

I suggest this because the default shell is bash. This is pretty awesome. If you set coreutils by default, most bash scripts scripts written for GNU + Linux will run. Also, because, why not. These are Ghz+ multi-core devices we run on, with gigabytes of internal storage, no need for busybox.

I also suggest adding the net-tools package for networking.

body:
Termux is awesome, when combined with a foldable bluetooth keyboard. It becomes a full workstation powerhouse on the go. 

Except the screen size is still tiny for code editing even on a Nexus 6p. The proposal is to support Cardboard VR mode / render terminal content in steroscopic, potentailly using Cardboard API (but other options fine too). 

Imagine carrying just your smartphone and a small keyboard and a cardboard Goggle, with infinite terminal windows by just moving around your ahead.

https://developers.google.com/cardboard/android/get-started

title: clisp
body: I use lisp primarily as a calculator, But even still I miss it. It doesn't cap numbers as low.

title: Erase sequences should not be affected by current coloring
body:
This will color the whole termux terminal red: `echo -e '\033[41m\033[J'`. No other terminal emulators that I know of exhibit this behavior.

This is because termux fill the affected area with the current foreground and background coloring when it receives the erase area sequence `\033[J`.

The erase line sequence, `\033[K`, is also affected.

title: Ctrl key with Sogou Pinyin doesn't work
label: [Label(name="Keyboard"), Label(name="bug report")]
body:
I'm connecting a keyboard with USB OTG. Pressing `ctrl` on the keyboard works neither in shell nor in any command line applications. (`vtshowkeys` prints nothing when I press `ctrl`).
Here is the `logcat` output when I pressed `ctrl-C` in shell, if helpful:
![screenshot_2016-02-13-20-26-02_com termux](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1381301/13031174/d82eb5d0-d290-11e5-8c15-d356166d0746.png)
The IM I'm using is Sogou Pinyin. Its keyboard is hidden during testing. 
Changing IM to Google Pinyin fixes `ctrl`, but `Esc` won't work, similar to #40. 
Thanks

title: Won't run Android Runtime for Chrome
body:
Following the [official instructions](https://developer.chrome.com/apps/getstarted_arc) and using ARC Welder with the latest apk, I got the following error:

![capture image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/582021/13030368/94141c24-d2a8-11e5-8c5f-7d0d1bf31c97.png)

Weirdly, running `plugin.shell('logcat')` in the JavaScript console, which is supposed to do the same thing as a `logcat` on Android, doesn't give me anything.

As a side note, running `plugin.shell('getprop ro.build.version.sdk')` outputs `21` which means that ARC is emulating Android 5.0. Also, the ARC team considers incompatibilities due to difference between ARC and Android to be bugs of ARC, so I think technically it is possible. Is there any interest?

PS. I came here because I wanted to debug [this elvish bug](https://github.com/elves/elvish/issues/120) and wondered if I could do that on my Chromebook :)

title: Add swipe gestures to switch between open terminals
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

I often have multiple terminal open, and switching between them is cumbersome: edge swipe for menu, select other terminal, I have not found a key shortcut for it either.

Since swiping up/down scrolls the buffer, swiping left/right coud easily switch between the open terminals.

This featuree request relates to or can interact with mouse event generation of #35

title: Possibility of Termux bundle
body:
I have a device that doesn't have any user facing Internet connection (Android Wear smartwatch) 

I was wondering is there a way to transfer a pre-setup environment along with the application on install or maybe placing the environment in the right place after install? It's unable to download the initial environment due to no Internet access directly on the watch. (Termux actually launches and tries but just continues to spin on the setup screen)

title: Usable on 2nd user?
body:
Termux app when installed in 2nd user and opened, complains that it can only be installed on primary account. 

Can it be made usable on 2nd user? Only for those commands not requiring superuser access.

title: "apt update" hangs with "93% [Working]" on CM13 (One Plus One)
body: Subject says it--it doesn't seem to actually ever finish. Not sure what it's up to. Strace is inconclusive, insofar as it seems to be hanging in a `select()` loop.

title: Option to get previous behavior with respect to hiding keyboard and entering ESC
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Now termux by default behaves standardly, with the triangle retracting the keyboard instead of sending the escape key. I like the old behavior better, with the triangle sending the escape key and a touch on the screen hiding the keyboard. I've managed to get the triangle=esc behavior back by setting that up on termux.properties, and I am wondering if I can also set the single touch on the screen to hide the keyboard. Is there a way?

Maybe the zip files could be checked into a Github blob repository?

title: I am stuck in Google's keyboard...
body:
This started about the time I bought the styling app, so I suppose there is a slight chance this is related. Google's keyboard lacks too many modifier, function, and arrow keys to be useful on a cli app like Termux. I have the hacker's keyboard set, and it works in all other apps; with the exception of Termux.

I am sorry for not reporting this sooner, but I've been setting up a new laptop. I am running on a 1st gen N7 rooted w/ cyanogenMod. 

I updated Termux/packages on an Identical N7 except 4 it's stock rooted, w/o the styling app; and it's Termux still picks up the Hacker's Keyboard just fine.

I am going to try w/o the styling app, and see if that helps. I might also try wiping the app cache 4 Termux. If these steps fail I will try a backup/reinstall of Termux.

I'll report back if anything I can come up w/ works.

btw This is Kevin Lausen from G+ & kjlw_99 on irc

title: programs that produce a lot of output freezes app.
body:
I ran to this issue again today,
https://plus.google.com/u/0/105143408064070053742/posts/SckNbhF6RQY
I was busy with other stuffs so I had made a quick post there hoping someone would chime in..  great to know that issues I wanted to report with C++ linking and play-audio have been resolved already.

Anyways back to current issue, programs that write a lot of output to terminal freezes app. I investigated it a bit and it doesnt happen if the write is limited..

Here's a test case..
Run a program that writes to terminal
`find $PREFIX/lib`
The terminal will output until a new line and freeze until the command completes.

Now limit the output with pv.
`apt install pv`
 `find $PREFIX/lib | pv -L 2048`
The output will be scrolled too fast to read in the terminal but it doesnt freeze the app.

title: Add support for mouse gestures.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In certain programs you can use mouse gestures to do various tasks, for example:
- tmux lets you resize panes with click and drag.
- weechat has swipe left and right gestures to switch buffer. 

This works when connecting to termux via SSH from a computer with mouse but it does not work when using the termux app. 
I realize that this would cause a conflict with the swipe to scroll feature, but maybe we can come up with a solution that can incorporate both these features. 
Some ways I came up with: 
- Move the long press menu into the left side drawer and have long press function as a click and drag. 
- Have a switch (or one time function like select) in the long press menu to switch between click and drag and scroll. In the two programs I came across with mouse dragging it is not something you have to do all the time, so having an additional step between might not be that bad. 

Maybe someone has a better idea?

title: Can't select text on the left side of the terminal because of the drawer
body:
Right now, I can't select text that starts at column 0 in the terminal because the drawer that slides out from the left takes precedence. That drawer should be disabled when selecting.

It would also be nice if there was some way of confirming/correcting the selection, since it's difficult to tell which tiny character my finger is about to touch.

The simplest hack would be a little pop-up that says "is this selection correct?", and if not, the user is put back into selection mode.

title: Add support for Samsung's multi-window
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Would be nice to have a web page or video open next to my Termux shell in splitscreen, [docs available here](http://developer.samsung.com/resources/multiwindow).

title: Escape sequence for scrolling down broken with a top scroll margin
body:
The Termux implementation of the `${CSI}${N}T` escape sequence to scroll down N lines ([SD - Pan Up](http://vt100.net/docs/vt510-rm/SD)) does not take the top margin into account when figuring out where to place the scrolled rows.

A simple shell script to reproduce the issue

```
clear
for i in 1 2 3 4 5; do printf "${i}\r\n"; done
printf "\033[3r" # Top scroll margin to 3.
printf "\033[2T" # Scroll down.
read
reset
```

This should leave the screen containing

```
1
2


3
4
5
```

due to the scroll margin protecting the top two lines.

One program that is affected is `htop`, which (with a long enough list of processes relative to the terminal) sets the top margin to protect the upper CPU usage area before scrolling the list below, causing garbled display in Termux. This was reported in https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/issues/86.

title: Google Pixel C Keyboard Escape key handling
body:
Hi,

I have recently (naturally) aquired a Pixel C with the Pixel C Keyboard. Almost everything seems to be working, there is just an annoyance preventing me from using termux fully.
Since they Pixel C Keyboard is missing keys, there are build-in [hotkeys](https://support.google.com/pixel/answer/6326992?hl=en) for the missing ones. However:

If I press the ![...](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/FS30qf3hlMsphqXMswSDwRgvOnHTBOG0Tnip2Gb5hnNOvW6VkKf8u6jL1zJBmMG8vvJi=w18-rwa)+1 key that maps to escape I _also_ get the extended-keys soft-keyboard. It makes vi quite frustrating to use :)

I believe this is an issue with termux because:
- other programs I tried to not have this behaviour
- termux does not have this behavour with other keys like [ or ] that are also not present as physical keys.
- escape keys are funny with terminals :)

title: Cannot use mercurial
body:
I keep on getting amazed by this app. I'm trying to use mercurial, I installed it by:

```
apt install python2 python2-dev gcc
pip2 install mercurial
```

It works! But then:

```
$ hg help
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/bin/hg", line 41, in <module>
    mercurial.util.setbinary(fp)
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 130, in __getattribute__
    self._load()
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 96, in _load
    mod = _hgextimport(_import, head, globals, locals, None, level)
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 53, in _hgextimport
    return importfunc(name, globals, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/util.py", line 33, in <module>
    cachestat = platform.cachestat
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 130, in __getattribute__
    self._load()
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 96, in _load
    mod = _hgextimport(_import, head, globals, locals, None, level)
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/demandimport.py", line 53, in _hgextimport
    return importfunc(name, globals, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/posix.py", line 32, in <module>
    oslink = os.link
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'link'
```

I'm not sure if I did something wrong, if it is Termux bug, Mercurial's, or if the fix would be a Mercurial package. Any help please?

title: Cannot write to external SD card
body:
```
$ touch /storage/extSdCard/test
touch: /storage/extSdCard/test: Permission denied
```

I guess this comes from Android 5's new permissions for SD cards. Any way to fix it?

title: Option to show bold text in bright color
body: Some programs like htop show bold black text on black background, and it's impossible to see, so it would be nice to have an option to display bold text in bright color.

title: Closing virtual keyboard with back button
body: Termux does not seem to allow you to close the virtual keyboard with the back button, even though the icon turns into a downwards-pointing triangle. This is annoying in apps that take control of the mouse such as htop.

title: Option to quit app
body: There is no clear way to quit the app, even after selecting Hangup.

title: Option to run commands at boot
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Would it be possible to run commands (like sshd) automatically after the device boots?

title: Minor changes in README and adding an EditorConfig file
Which version(s) of Apache license?

In README.md, it is written that "Contains code from Terminal Emulator for Android which is released under the Apache License". But is it under version 1.0, version 2.0, version 1.0 and 2.0, version 1.0 or at your option any later, version 2.0 or at your option any later?

Regards.

title: Support armeabi and mips
body: Any reason why native code for these architectures isn't compiled? As far as I can tell, it would be as simple as adding those to `Application.mk`. Unless you intentionally left them out for a reason.

body:

Do you think it makes sense and is possible to add such an option, for example to perform encfs or sshfs mounts controlled by scripts?

title: [FR] The alternative offline-install apk
body:
First, thank you for this application. It's really promising.
I was surprised by small apk size (130kB), but the first run ruined that surprise. It took 7 minutes to download the bootstrap package on my 64kb/s connection. Having the base pacakge installed with the apk would be useful for people with no or limited internet access.
Cheers!
